revised_title: Two-Photon Laser Spectroscopy of Indium: Hybrid Resonances and Atomic Transitions
tldr: The authors observed two-photon transitions from the 5²P and 5²P states of indium to high-lying 2P and 2F states. They discovered a hybrid resonance through a dissociative intermediate state of In2 and discussed the atomic and molecular processes involved in the two-photon absorption. The study provides insights into the spectroscopy of elements with less volatility than alkali metals.
